meanings.definition: To defeat or gain control by receiving more votes than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: During the election, the team managed to outvote their opponents and secure a victory.
meanings.sent2: The group outvoted the proposal, showing their strong opposition.
meanings.sent3: The students decided to outvote the idea of having homework on weekends.
meanings.sent4: In the end, the community outvoted the construction of the new highway.
meanings.sent5: The team's strategy to outvote the rival team was successful.

meanings.definition: The act of voting against someone or something in order to gain control or defeat them.
meanings.sent1: The outvoting of the unpopular policy led to its removal from consideration.
meanings.sent2: There was a clear outvoting of the incumbent mayor in the recent election.
meanings.sent3: The outvoting of the proposal caused quite a stir among the members.
meanings.sent4: The outvoting of the motion left many feeling disappointed.
meanings.sent5: The outvoting of the new rule brought about a sense of unity among the group.
